description:
Morihito Otogi, a high school student who comes from a lineage of ogres, enjoys a peaceful, ordinary life until his childhood friend, Nico, moves in with him. Nico is a witch-in-training, and chooses Morihito to be her familiar. While Nico is thrilled to reunite with her old friend and crush, Morihito is tasked with the perilous duty to protect her from a foretold calamity. Between the unpredictable chaos caused by Nico’s magic, and the awkwardness of sharing a home, their lives become a whirlwind of supernatural hijinks and threats.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Notes:
- Worldwide premiere of Episodes 1-3 titled as WITCH WATCH: WATCH PARTY before the Japanese premiere was pre-screened in advance in theaters on March 16, 2025 in North America by GKIDS Films and March 22 and 23 in Europe by Animation Digital Network.
- Episodes 1-2 + a selection of stories (Cat Scout, Kanshi's Part Time Job Diaries ~ The Side Job ~, and Kan & Nico's Channel) was pre-screened in advance in theaters on March 30, 2025 in Japan. The regular TV broadcast began April 6, 2025.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Ice Skating
tags.description: Centers around the sport of ice skating.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
[Twitter](https://x.com/munyof)
Former assistant of [Hideaki Sorachi](https://anilist.co/staff/96904/Hideaki-Sorachi). The mangaka [Kentarou Yabuki](https://anilist.co/staff/96900/Kentarou-Yabuki) is his brother-in-law.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hal_i_00)

Married to fellow animator [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/).
Affiliated with [Bibury Animation CG](https://anilist.co/studio/7006).
[Twitter](https://x.com/kaisyu_man)
Affiliated with [Bibury Animation Studios](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/Bibury-Animation-Studios).
Formerly affiliated with [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/AIC), currently working at [Senju Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/7581/Senju-Kobo).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mykGhf)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.
Ping Xue is a background artist who works at Kusanagi.

__[Website](https://www.yoasobi-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoasobi_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

__Introduction:__
YOASOBI is a Japanese music duo consisting of vocaloid music producer Ayase and vocalist Ikura. The group have released four music videos, all of which are based on short stories posted on Monogatary, a website operated by Sony Music Japan.

__Biography:__
Both members of Yoasobi had active music careers prior to forming the group. Ayase gained a following on the video hosting site Niconico since his first upload on December 24, 2018, a song titled Sentensei Assault Girl. On November 23, 2019, he released an EP, Yuurei Tokyo, which reached third on iTunes' album chart. Rira Ikuta, performing under the name Ikura, had already released two EPs: Rerise in 2017 and Jukebox in 2019.

The first song released by the duo was "Yoru ni Kakeru", based on Mayo Hoshino's short story "Thanatos no Yuuwaku" hosted on Monogatary. The music video was released first on November 16, 2019, where it broke 10 million views in five months on YouTube as well as being popular on TikTok. It was subsequently released as a single on December 15, 2019, where it topped the popularity charts on both Spotify and Line Music. More than five months after its release, the single would top the Billboard Japan Hot 100 on June 1, 2020.

Following the success of their first release, on January 18, 2020, Yoasobi released their second single, "Ano Yume wo Nazotte", this time based on Souta Ishiki's "Yume no Shizuku to Hoshi no Hana". On April 20, 2020, Yoasobi released a teaser for their third single, "Halzion", which is based on Shunki Hashizume's "Soredemo, Happy End". "Halzion" marked the first time that Yoasobi collaborated with a professional novelist, whereas the first two were amateur writers. The single was released as a promotional project by Suntory to advertise their new energy drink named Zone. The single was official released on May 11, 2020.

__Members:__
- [Ayase](https://anilist.co/staff/198948/Ayase) (あやせ) – composer and arranger
- [Lilas Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/199392/) (幾田りら), better known as Ikura – vocalist and lyricist

Note: YOASOBI also releases an English Version of their songs after the initial release of the Japanese version.
[English Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0OtpJgD2obWAuQF8yk0_F77) 
[Japanese Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0Nv3uFq7ka52rndi7_KJE41)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

[Website](https://lilasikuta.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikutalilas) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lilasikuta/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCztEY6czNyJKjRWMwuur9bg) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1qM11R4ylJyQiPJ0DffE9z)

Lilas Ikuta is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/). She is also formerly a member of PLUSONICA and a 4th Generation member of the LESSON, a program made by Sony Music Japan that bases sending artists out into the world, and they draw out each student's potential and give them a thorough lesson on how to become an artist.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

[Website](https://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/Aooo/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Aooo_band) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aooo_band/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@aooo_band) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Aooo_band)

A Japanese four-piece rock band . The band name comes from the fact that the members' blood types are A, O, O, and O.

__Members:__
- Riko Ishino (石野理子) – vocals, guitar, keyboard
- [Surii](https://anilist.co/staff/192559/) (すりぃ) – guitar, chorus
- [Hikaru Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/300002/) (やまもとひかる) – bass, chorus
- [Tsumiki](https://anilist.co/staff/288398/) (ツミキ) – drums

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iii0303_8) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHGKS3VDKxu3N1u9naM0XYA) Surii is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer. Best known for his various original vocaloid songs featuring [Len Kagamine](https://anilist.co/staff/154290/Len-Kagamine).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iii0303_8) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHGKS3VDKxu3N1u9naM0XYA) Surii is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer. Best known for his various original vocaloid songs featuring [Len Kagamine](https://anilist.co/staff/154290/Len-Kagamine).
